alert.note: Alert for Greater Portland Metro Area (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Wind Advisory issued January 15 at 2:13AM PST until January 16 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST TUESDAY... * WHAT...East to northeast winds 15 to 30 mph, with gusts 40 to 50 mph. Strongest winds will be near the Columbia Gorge and across the West Hills of Portland. * WHERE...Greater Portland Metro Area. * WHEN...Until 10 AM PST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Trees or tree limbs could be blown down and power outages may result. Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Strongest winds will initially be limited to the Gorge and elevated terrain around the metro area, but will become more widespread during the day Monday, persisting through Tuesday morning.
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects.
